project_overview.name: get_project_overview
project_overview.description: Call this tool when you need to understand the business context, target audience, or core functionality of the project. Use this information to make decisions about feature implementation, user experience, and business logic alignment. Essential for ensuring your code serves the intended business purpose and user needs.

business_description.description: Clear description of what the business/project does, its value proposition, and core objectives

target_users.description: Detailed description of the intended users, their needs, technical level, and use cases

main_features.description: List of primary features and functionality that define the project's core capabilities

project_structure.name: get_project_structure
project_structure.description: Use this tool to retrieve the overall structure of the project, including key directories and files. This is crucial for understanding how the project is organized, which can inform your decisions on where to place new code, how to navigate the codebase, and how to maintain consistency across the project.

naming_conventions.description: File naming patterns, variable naming styles, class naming conventions

architecture_approach.description: Architectural patterns, design principles, code organization strategies

considering.name: get_considering
considering.description: Call this tool to access important considerations, concerns, best practices, and anti-patterns that AI agents should be aware of when working on this project. This includes guidance on what to prioritize, what to avoid, and important contextual factors that should influence decision-making and code implementation.
